summary: Tribe explores the concept of modern tribalism in our interconnected world. It delves into how technology and global connectivity have reshaped social structures, creating new forms of group identity and belonging. This theme examines the tension between global unity and fragmented communities, highlighting the challenges and opportunities of navigating diverse cultural landscapes in the digital age. It encourages reflection on how we form connections and maintain individuality in an era of simultaneous global existence.
excerpt: Marshall McLuhan's global village concept predicts technology connecting the world leads to simultaneous existence and new tribalism. This manifests in today's digital landscape, eroding cultural distinctions and creating echo chambers.
